item.title: Report X-2023081913
item.description:
Report X-2023081913

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet in the trailer, QA was called. We used spill pads to clean up the spilled product. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081881
item.description:
Report X-2023081881

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to pick up a leaking package, once QA arrived it was found that the package was a hazmat. Package was put into a lined tote and a spill pad was used to clean up the leaked product. DescribePack: Cap came loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was put back on and tightened and package was up in an upright position in a lined tote.

We used neutralizer to clean up the spill then secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. item.title: Report X-2023081625
item.description:
Report X-2023081625

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the box was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The package had several stains on the outside of it. Upon being opened, the cap on one of the bottles was noticed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a spill tote to contain further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023081591
item.description:
Report X-2023081591

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock leaking. QA was called to pick up package. Package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up minor spill. DescribePack: When package was inspected it was found that the cap and seal under cap was intact and tight. built in handle on bottle was cracked and leaking. No obvious signs of crushing or too much weight being put on top of package that would of caused damage to built in handle on bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote and kept in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023080949
item.description:
Report X-2023080949

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 31st during the PM sort a package was found to be leaking. The package did not show any signs on the outside that it was a regulated dangerous good. There were no marks, labels, or documentation. Upon further investigation the package was opened and it contained Mrs. Meyers Clean Day Room Freshener, Lilac Scent, one of which had leaked An SDS was located and it shows that it is regulated as UN1170 Ethanol Solution(Ethyl Alcohol), 3, PGIII. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held at the station pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023081780
item.description:
Report X-2023081780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT LEAKED A BOTTLE OF RUFFINO PROSECCO ROSE WINE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE BOX OF FEDERAL AMERICAN EAGLE 180 GRAIN AMMUNITION WITH 25 ROUNDS IN THE BOX OF 50. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF AT A UPS STORE IN FLORIDA USING A NEW UPS INTERNET ACCOUNT 2B7B5T, TAAHIR FITCHET, 6541 AUTUMN WIND CIRCLE, CLARKSVILLE MD 21029.

  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED CALL FOR A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT ON PD 3. RESPONDER SAW THAT IT WAS LEAKING. THEN USED DECISION TREE AND PUT ON THE PROPER PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023081770
item.description:
Report X-2023081770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE THAT HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) 5 LITER JUGS OF FLAMMABLE ASP CIDEX OPA CONCENTRATE THAT WERE PACKAGED IN THE BOX UPSIDE DOWN WITH ONE OF THE JUGS LEAKING FROM A LOOSE CLOSURE.

item.description:
Report X-2023081465

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN INTERNATIONAL PACKAGE DUE TO A DOCUMENT SEARCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE CONTAINED (14) INNER BOXES CONTAINING (20) INDIVIDUAL MAD BULL DOG FIREWORKS. EACH FIREWORK CONATINS 5G OF BLACK POWDER EXPLOSIVE. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023081149
item.description:

  • City: INDEPENDENCE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped during handling, wet spot was found later and QA was called to pick up package. Package was put in to a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Package was dropped causing cap on one bottle to crack and product to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote and kept in an upright position.
